name: AJEnglish
text:
THREAD üëá

It's #Juneteenth

Juneteenth, a blend of June and 19th, is the annual commemoration marking the emancipation of African American slaves.

Here's a guide on what the day represents: https://t.co/xSdBBKp8Mj https://t.co/IN59w0KV2n

name: AJEnglish
text:
1-What is #Juneteenth?

The day commemorates the US abolition of slavery under President Abraham Lincoln's 1863 Emancipation Proclamation, belatedly announced by a Union army in Galveston, Texas, on June 19, 1865, after the Civil War ended https://t.co/AiROVP2wDw https://t.co/ra7zVAgX4k

name: AJEnglish
text:
2-How is #Juneteenth commemorated?

The date reached new dimensions in 1872 when a group of African Americans in Houston bought 10 acres of land and created Emancipation Park, a place that became home for their Juneteenth celebration https://t.co/AiROVP2wDw https://t.co/5WpCMCiAdd

name: AJEnglish
text:
3-How will #Juneteenth be celebrated this year?

#Juneteenth2020 Celebrations will be marked from coast to coast with marches and protests of civil disobedience https://t.co/AiROVP2wDw https://t.co/M2iv6lPcCI

name: AJEnglish
text:
4-Why is #Juneteenth significant this year? 

#Juneteenth2020 coincides with global #BlackLivesMatter protests against racial injustice & police brutality sparked by the May 25 killing of #GeorgeFloyd in Minneapolis police custody https://t.co/AiROVP2wDw https://t.co/dSksBWGprV
